item.title: Ethics and Best Practices for Mapping Archaeological Sites
item.description:
Cecilia Smith

Abstract

Principle 6 of the Society of American Archaeology’s Principles of Archaeological Ethics emphasizes archaeologists’ responsibility to publically report archaeological investigations with the stipulation that “An interest in preserving and protecting in situ archaeological sites must be taken in to account when publishing and distributing information about …
item.dc:creator: Cecilia Smith
